findings.title: A01.Reentrancy due to Solidity send and transfer functions
findings.description: Reentrancy vulnerability due to the use of Solidity send and transfer functions which can be exploited with EIP-1283's new gas computation, breaking reentrancy mitigation used by already deployed contracts.

findings.title: Proposition #1 changes the semantics of existing contracts
findings.description: This proposal introduces versioning to the EVM which might lead to unexpected behaviors in already deployed contracts.

findings.title: Proposition #2 does not fix the issue
findings.description: Proposition #2 is a good long term recommendation but does not address the security risks of EIP-1283.

findings.title: Unthoroughly Analyzed Implications of Proposition #6
findings.description: Proposition #6 has potential implications that are not thoroughly analyzed

findings.title: B01.Reentrancy for calls with gas between 2300 and the minimal SSTORE gas price of 5000
findings.description: Reentrancy vulnerability due to EIP-1283 introducing cheaper state variable modifications, breaking reentrancy mitigation used by already deployed contracts.
